Luetzow Travelogue AD_MC_030_ref149New York University Abu Dhabi LibraryAbuDhabiThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-05-13T12:33:27
New York University Abu Dhabi Library
Hisham Khatib Collection - S.S. Luetzow Travelogue
Khatib, Hisham, Mr.
AD_MC_030_ref149
52 Leaves One album with string ties, containing 49 pages. Eight postcards and ship menus, forty gelatin silver photographs.
1930s Generally good, some brittle and warped. German Digital Copy Only 030_ref149
Content Description
A photographic travelogue of a voyage taken on the S.S. Luetzow, second oriental cruise run by Norddeutscher Lloyd Bremen in April and May 1930 beginning at Venice, stopping at Istanbul, Athens, Palestine and Egypt, with handwritten notes in German.
Part of the Hisham Khatib Collection which contains 2,930 photographs and postcards (both individual prints and contained within albums) focussed on the Near East, including the Holy Land, Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt as well as a very small number from Europe.
Biographical / Historical
A photographic travelogue of a voyage taken on the S.S. Luetzow, second oriental cruise run by Norddeutscher Lloyd Bremen in April and May 1930. Part of the larger Hisham Khatib Collection.
Photographic Prints Gelatin Silver Prints Palestine Jordan Egypt Athens, Greece Istanbul, Turkey Landscapes Archaeological Sites/Artifacts Boats/Ships Khatib, Hisham, Mr.
